div.l: Lo where he goth ye lat þe children pleye
Thei gete him nouȝt so lyȝtly by my crown
Thise sely clerkes rennen vp and doun
Wit kepe kepe stand stand iossa warderere
Ga whistil þow and I sall kepe hym here
But shortly til it was v̉errey nyght
Thei couthe nouȝt þouȝ þei dede al hir might
Hire caple cacche he ran al wey so faste
Til in a diche þei caught him atte laste
Werey and wete as best is in þe rayn
Comth sely Iohn and wit hȳm comth Alayn
// Allas qduod Iohn þe day þat I was born
Now ar we dryuen til hething ⁊and til scorn
Oure corne is stole men wil vs foles calle
Boþe þe wardeyn and our͗e felow alle
And namly þe mellere weylawey
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goþ by þe wey
Toward the Melle and bayȝard in his hond
The Mellere sitting bi the fir he fond
For it was nyght ⁊and ferthere mighte he nouȝt
But for þe loue of god þei him bi souȝt
Of herberwe ⁊and of ese as for hire peny
The Mellere seide ageyn if þer be eny
Such as it is ȝet shal ye haue youre part
Mi hous is streit but ye han lerned art
Ȝe can bi argument make a place
A Mile brood of twenti fote of space
Lat se now yf þat þat þis place mow suffise
Or make it rowmer wit speche as is your gise
Now symond seid þis Iohn be seynt Cutberd
Ay is þu mery and þat is faire Answerd
I haue herd say men sall take of twa þinges
Swilk as he fynt or take swilk as he bringes
But specially I pray þe oost dere
Gete vs som mete ⁊and drynk ⁊and make vs chere
And wil payn trewely atte fulle
Wit empti handes men may noon haukes tulle
Lo here oure seluer redy for to spende
This Mellere to þe town his doughter sende
For ale ⁊and breed and rostede hem a goos
And bond hire hors it sholde nomore go loos
And in his owne chambre he made a bedde
